meanings.definition: A person who is mentally unstable or disturbed.
meanings.sent1: The sickos in the movie scared me.
meanings.sent2: The police were called to handle the group of sickos causing trouble.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about a group of silly sickos.
meanings.sent4: The dark alley was filled with shadows, making it seem like a gathering of unseen sickos.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house was full of eerie sounds, making visitors feel surrounded by invisible sickos.

meanings.definition: A group of people who exhibit abnormal or violent behavior.
meanings.sent1: The sickos at the party were causing chaos.
meanings.sent2: The news reported on a gang of sickos terrorizing the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie depicted a pack of bloodthirsty sickos on the loose.
meanings.sent4: The stormy night made the forest sound like it was filled with howling sickos.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned asylum was rumored to be haunted by the spirits of former sickos.

meanings.definition: To feel disgusted or repulsed by something.
meanings.sent1: I sickos at the sight of spoiled milk.
meanings.sent2: She always sickos when she sees spiders.
meanings.sent3: The smell of rotten eggs made everyone sickos at the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The taste of the strange dish made him sickos immediately.
meanings.sent5: The dirty public restroom made customers sickos and complain to the manager.
